name: pyrethroid-compound production | pyrethroid-compound | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7391/documentation

This dataset represents the production of pyrethroid-compounds (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation. Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;This dataset represents the production of pyrethroid-compounds (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation. Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.

From reception of precursors (acetonitrile, ammonia, bromine, butene, carbon tetrachloride, chlorine, ethanol, formaldehyde, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen cyanide, hydrogen fluoride, phenol, sodium hydroxide, toluene, water decarbonised, and "water, salt, sole") at the factory gate.

This activity ends with pyrethroid-compounds at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions. The dataset doesn't include emulsives, additives etc.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Pyrethroids are synthetic insecticides (typically cyclopropane carboxylates) structurally similar to pyrethrins, which are naturally occurring insecticidal compounds. They are produced by an esterification of chrysanthemic acid and an alcohol, e. g. PCBA.;;The dataset sulfonyl]urea-compounds was calculated from the arithmetic mean of all inputs and outputs of the production of alpha-cypermethrin, beta-cyfluthrin, cypermethrin, and lambda-cyhalothrin.;;alpha-Cypermethrin is produced in five steps from acetic acid:;C7H8 + Br2 → C7H7Br + HBr;C7H7Br + C6H6O → C13H12O + HBr;C13H12O + Br2 → C13H11BrO + HBr;C13H11BrO + C6H12N4 → C19H23BrNO4;C19H23BrNO4 + H2O → C13H10O2 + HBr + C6H12N4 + H2;C13H10O2 + HCN → C14H11NO2;C14H11NO2 + C10H14Cl2O2 → C22H19Cl2NO3 + C2H6O;Precursors that are used for the alpha-cypermethrin production are 2,2,-dimethyl-3-(2,2,-dichloro vinyl) cyclopropane carboxylic acid ethyl ester (DV acid ester) (C10H14Cl2O2), hexamine (C6H12N4), methyl-2-butene-1-ol (C5H10O), and sodium ethoxide (C2H5ONa).;;beta-Cyfluthrin is produced in eight steps from toluene:;C7H8 + 2 Br2 → C7H6Br2 + 2 HBr;C7H8 + HF → C7H6BrF + HBr;C7H6BrF + C6H6O → C13H11FO + HBr;C13H11FO + Br2 → C13H10BrFO + HBr;C13H10BrFO + C6H12N4 → C19H22BrFNO4;C19H22BrFNO4 + H2O → C13H9FO2 + HBr + C6H12N4 + H2;C13H9FO2 + HCN → C14H10FNO2;C14H10FNO2 + C10H14Cl2O2 → C22H18Cl2FNO3 + C2H6O;Precursors that are used for the beta-cyfluthrin production are 2,2,-dimethyl-3-(2,2,-dichloro vinyl) cyclopropane carboxylic acid ethyl ester (DV acid ester) (C10H14Cl2O2), hexamine (C6H12N4), methyl-2-butene-1-ol (C5H10O), and sodium ethoxide (C2H5ONa).;;Cypermethrin is produced in five steps from acetic acid:;C7H8 + Br2 → C7H7Br + HBr;C7H7Br + C6H6O → C13H12O + HBr;C13H12O + Br2 → C13H11BrO + HBr;C13H11BeO + C6H12N4 → C19H23BrNO4;C19H23BrNO4 + H2O → C13H10O2 + HBr + C6H12N4 + H2;C13H10O2 + HCN → C14H11NO2;C14H11NO2 + C10H14Cl2O2 → C22H19Cl2NO3 + C2H6O;Precursors that are used for the cypermethrin production are 2,2,-dimethyl-3-(2,2,-dichloro vinyl) cyclopropane carboxylic acid ethyl ester (DV acid ester) (C10H14Cl2O2), hexamine (C6H12N4), methyl-2-butene-1-ol (C5H10O), and sodium ethoxide (C2H5ONa).;;lambda-Cyhalothrin is produced in seven steps from toluene: ;C7H8 + Br2 → C7H7Br + HBr;C7H7Br + C6H6O → C13H12O + HBr;C13H12O + Br2 → C13H11BrO + HBr;C13H11BeO + C6H12N4 → C19H23BrNO4;C19H23BrNO4 + H2O → C13H10O2 + HBr + C6H12N4 + H2;C13H10O2 + HCN → C14H11NO2;C14H11NO2 + C9H9Cl2F3O → C23H19ClF3NO3 + HCl;Precursors that are used for the lambda-cyhalothrin production are hexamine (C6H12N4), intermediate 6 (C9H9Cl2F3O), methyl-2-butene-1-ol (C5H10O), potassium tert-butoxide (C4H9OK), sodium ethoxide (C2H5ONa), thionyl chloride (SOCl2), and 1,1,1-trichloro-2,2,2-trifluoroethane (C2Cl3F3).;;Precursors:                                                ;;2,2,-Dimethyl-3-(2,2,-dichloro vinyl) cyclopropane carboxylic acid ethyl ester (DV acid ester) (C10H14Cl2O2) is produced in five steps from acetonitrile and ethanol:;C2H3N + C2H6O + HCl → C4H10ClNO;C4H10ClNO + 2 C2H5ONa + HCl → C8H18O3 + 2 NaCl + NH3;C8H18O3 + C5H10O → C9H16O2 + 2 C2H6O;C9H16O2 + CCl4 → C10H16Cl4O2;C10H16Cl4O2 + C2H5ONa → C10H14Cl2O2 + NaCl + HCl + C2H6O                           ;;Hexamine (C6H12N4) is produced from formaldehyde and ammonia:;6 CH2O + 6 NH3 → C6H12N4 + 6 H2O;;Intermediate 6 (C9H9Cl2F3O) is produced in six steps from acetonitrile:;C2H3N + C2H6O + HCl → C4H10ClNO;C4H10ClNO + 2 C2H5ONa + HCl → C8H18O3 + 2 NaCl + NH3;C8H18O3 + C5H10O → C9H16O2 + 2 C2H6O;C9H16O2 + C2Cl3F3 → C11H16Cl3F3O2;C11H16Cl3F3O2 + C4H9OK → C11H14ClF3O2 + HCl + C4H10O + KCl;C11H14ClF3O2 + SOCl2 + H2O → C9H9Cl2F3O + C2H6O + SO2 + HCl;;Methyl-2-butene-1-ol (C5H10O) is produced in two steps from formaldehyde:;3 CH2O → C3H6O3;C3H6O3 + C4H8 → C5H10O + 2 CH4O;;Potassium tert-butoxide (C4H9OK) is produced from tert-butanol and potassium hydroxide:;C4H10O + KOH → C4H9OK + H2O       ;;Sodium ethoxide (C2H5ONa) is produced from ethanol and sodium hydroxide:;C2H6O + NaOH → C2H5ONa + H2O;                                    ;Thionyl chloride (SOCl2) is produced in two steps from sulphur:;S + Cl2 → SCl2;SCl2 + SO2 + Cl2 → 2 SOCl2;;1,1,1-Trichloro-2,2,2-trifluoroethane (C2Cl3F3) is produced in two steps from ethane:;C2H6 + 6 Cl2 → C2Cl6 + 6 HCl;C2Cl6 + 3 HF → C2Cl3F3 + 3 HCl

exchanges.description:
Estimation, based on a production capacity of 50,000 t per year and a plant life time of 50 years, therefore an amount of 4X10-10 units per kg of produced chemical  is aded to the unit process of the respective chemical. The amount is accounted for each production step. This might be an overestimation in some multistep syntheses.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
There is an intermediate containing bromine in this process and this input is used as an input in the bromine production.

The concentration of bromine in water, salt, sole is 0.23% = 0.0023kg/kg. Cross-referenced: 0.25% (Ullmann's encyclopedia), 0.4% (USGS). The concentration of iodine in water, salt, sole is 0.03% = 0.0003kg/kg. Cross-referenced: 0.015% - 0.12% (Ullmann's encyclopedia).
There is an intermediate containing bromine in this process and this input is used as an input in the bromine production.

The concentration of bromine in water, salt, sole is 0.23% = 0.0023kg/kg. Cross-referenced: 0.25% (Ullmann's encyclopedia), 0.4% (USGS). The concentration of iodine in water, salt, sole is 0.03% = 0.0003kg/kg. Cross-referenced: 0.015% - 0.12% (Ullmann's encyclopedia).

flow.name: Fluoride
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description:
Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of electricity of 0,333 kW for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 38% electricity.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.
EcoSpold01Location=UCTE

exchanges.description: Estimation, based on the assumption that 0.2% of volatile input materials is emitted to air occurring from the purge vent, the destillation vent and fugitive emission sources. Remaining gases like CH4 or CO are oxidated to CO2. The carbon contained in the removed carbon compounds from wastewater treatment was accounted as CO2 emissions to air (assuming  a removal efficiency of 90%).

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/unspecified

exchanges.description: Estimation, assuming that the remaining amount of unreacted input materials leave the production process with the wastewater, wich is further treated in an internal wastewater plant. For the nitrogen containing compounds within the wastewater a removal efficiency of 50% was assumed. The nitrogen emitted to air (N2) is neglected.

flow.name: Ammonium
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description: Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of heat of 2 MJ for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 12% steam from external energy sources.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.
